column4: hi, how do I add external USB mouse on feisty? I am on lenovo R60
I can see it being detected in dmesg
its is not working
usb mice and keyboards are supposed to "Just Work (tm)". plug in - that's it. if it does not work try a different usb port
it isn't working on a different USB port as well
is the mouse working on another computer (or with the Ubuntu live CD?)
yes.. it works on other computers
here is my dmesg output http://pastebin.ca/708886
are the disconnect message from when you have remove the mouse or did it disconnect by itself?
nope, I did, I changed the USB port
can you pastebin your /etc/X11/xorg.conf?
here is my xorg.conf file http://pastebin.ca/708896
ok.. got it.. I need to add another section there it seems
for external mouse

I just double checked the config and, no, you shouldn't have to. your mouse points to /dev/input/mice which all plugged in mice should use. if it would have pointed to a serial device then, yes you would have had to add a new section.... I have no idea what's going on. have you tried to boot the computer with the mouse plugged in?
no, I did not try booting it with mouse plugged in
going to reboot with mouse plugged in
unless there is some touchpad setting for laptops I'm not aware of, several mices should be able to be plugged in at the same time...
yes, same thing is working on my other lappy
also an Ubuntu system?
nope, its a debian system
good enough ;)
see you in some more time.. rebooting
does it also use a synaptics touchpad or is it a stationary PC?
